circumstances: En route from Georgetown to Miami by night, while on a cargo flight on behalf of Guyana Airways, the crew noticed a fuel leak on the n°3 main fuel system. Despite the situation, the crew decided to continue to Miami when, few minutes later, all four engines failed. As the crew realized it was not possible to fly to Miami, he reduced his altitude and ditched the aircraft into the Biscayne Bay. All three crew members were rescued while the aircraft sank and was lost.
probable_cause:
Failure of all four engines due to fuel exhaustion. The following factors were reported:
- Fuel leak, 
- Mismanagement of fuel, 
- Inattentive to fuel supply,
- Improper in-flight planning, 
- Fuel exhaustion, 
- Failure of all four engines, 
- Forced landing off airport on water,
- Leak on n°3 main fuel system, 
- Overflew Nassau and Bimini with low fuel.
